intro: Rutheopsis herbanica, commonly known as the herbaceous rutheopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers during the summer months. Rutheopsis herbanica thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
